SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The ID of the target subscription. The value must be an UUID.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for this operation.

ResourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
ResourceGroupNameParameter.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.

If-Match.name: ifMatch
If-Match.description: The If-Match header that makes a request conditional.

If-None-Match.name: ifNoneMatch
If-None-Match.description: The If-None-Match header that makes a request conditional.

LocationParameter.name: location
LocationParameter.description: The name of the Azure region.

ManagementGroupNameParameter.name: managementGroupName
ManagementGroupNameParameter.description: The name of the management group. The name is case insensitive.

OperationIdParameter.name: operationId
OperationIdParameter.description: The ID of an ongoing async operation.

ScopeParameter.name: scope
ScopeParameter.description: The scope at which the operation is performed.

TenantIdParameter.name: tenantId
TenantIdParameter.description: The Azure tenant ID. This is a GUID-formatted string (e.g. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)

licenseTextLink.description: Link to HTML with Microsoft and Publisher terms.

privacyPolicyLink.description: Link to the privacy policy of the publisher.

retrieveDatetime.description: Date and time in UTC of when the terms were accepted. This is empty if Accepted is false.

accepted.description: If any version of the terms have been accepted, otherwise false.

properties.description: Represents the properties of the resource.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results, if any.

CreateResourceSupportedProperties.description: Datadog resource can be created or not properties.

name.description: The ARM id of the subscription.

creationSupported.description: Indicates if selected subscription supports Datadog resource creation, if not it is already being monitored for the selected organization via multi subscription feature.

CreateResourceSupportedResponse.description: Datadog resource can be created or not.

properties.description: Represents the properties of the resource.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results, if any.

createdBy.description: The user that created the API key.

name.description: The name of the API key.

key.description: The value of the API key.

created.description: The time of creation of the API key.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results, if any.

aliases.description: The aliases for the host installed via the Datadog agent.

apps.description: The Datadog integrations reporting metrics for the host.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results, if any.

LinkedResource.description: The definition of a linked resource.

id.description: The ARM id of the linked resource.

location.description: The location of the linked resource.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results, if any.

MonitoredResource.description: The properties of a resource currently being monitored by the Datadog monitor resource.

id.description: The ARM id of the resource.

sendingMetrics.description: Flag indicating if resource is sending metrics to Datadog.

reasonForMetricsStatus.description: Reason for why the resource is sending metrics (or why it is not sending).

sendingLogs.description: Flag indicating if resource is sending logs to Datadog.

reasonForLogsStatus.description: Reason for why the resource is sending logs (or why it is not sending).

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results, if any.

BillingInfoResponse.description: Marketplace Subscription and Organization details to which resource gets billed into.

partnerBillingEntity.description: Partner Billing Entity details: Organization Info

MarketplaceSaaSInfo.description: Marketplace SAAS Info of the resource.

marketplaceSubscriptionId.description: Marketplace Subscription Id. This is a GUID-formatted string.

marketplaceStatus.description: Marketplace Subscription Details: SaaS Subscription Status

billedAzureSubscriptionId.description: The Azure Subscription ID to which the Marketplace Subscription belongs and gets billed into.

subscribed.description: Flag specifying if the Marketplace status is subscribed or not.

PartnerBillingEntity.description: Partner Billing details associated with the resource.

partnerEntityUri.description: Link to the datadog organization page

MonitoredSubscription.description: The list of subscriptions and it's monitoring status by current Datadog monitor.

error.description: The reason of not monitoring the subscription.

SubscriptionList.description: The request to update subscriptions needed to be monitored by the Datadog monitor resource.

operation.description: The operation for the patch on the resource.

monitoredSubscriptionList.description: List of subscriptions and the state of the monitoring.

MonitoredSubscriptionProperties.description: The request to update subscriptions needed to be monitored by the Datadog monitor resource.

name.description: Name of the monitored subscription resource.

id.description: The id of the monitored subscription resource.

type.description: The type of the monitored subscription resource.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results, if any.

OperationDisplay.description: The object that represents the operation.

resource.description: Type on which the operation is performed, e.g., 'monitors'.

operation.description: Operation type, e.g., read, write, delete, etc.

description.description: Description of the operation, e.g., 'Write monitors'.

isDataAction.description: Indicates whether the operation is a data action

OperationListResult.description: A list of REST API operations supported by an Azure Resource Provider. It contains an URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of operations supported by the resource provider

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results (if there are any).

name.description: Name of the SKU in {PlanId} format. For Terraform, the only allowed value is 'Linked'.

MonitoringStatus.description: Flag specifying if the resource monitoring is enabled or disabled.

MarketplaceSubscriptionStatus.description: Flag specifying the Marketplace Subscription Status of the resource. If payment is not made in time, the resource will go in Suspended state.

DatadogOrganizationProperties.description: Specify the Datadog organization name. In the case of linking to existing organizations, Id, ApiKey, and Applicationkey is required as well.

linkingAuthCode.description: The auth code used to linking to an existing Datadog organization.

linkingClientId.description: The client_id from an existing in exchange for an auth token to link organization.

apiKey.description: Api key associated to the Datadog organization.

applicationKey.description: Application key associated to the Datadog organization.

enterpriseAppId.description: The Id of the Enterprise App used for Single sign on.

cspm.description: The configuration which describes the state of cloud security posture management. This collects configuration information for all resources in a subscription and track conformance to industry benchmarks.

UserInfo.description: Includes name, email and optionally, phone number. User Information can't be null.

emailAddress.description: Email of the user used by Datadog for contacting them if needed

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of the user used by Datadog for contacting them if needed

MonitorProperties.description: Properties specific to the monitor resource.

ManagedIdentityTypes.description: Specifies the identity type of the Datadog Monitor. At this time the only allowed value is 'SystemAssigned'.

id.description: ARM id of the monitor resource.

type.description: The type of the monitor resource.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results, if any.

MonitorUpdateProperties.description: The set of properties that can be update in a PATCH request to a monitor resource.

cspm.description: The new cloud security posture management value of the monitor resource. This collects configuration information for all resources in a subscription and track conformance to industry benchmarks.

DatadogMonitorResourceUpdateParameters.description: The parameters for a PATCH request to a monitor resource.

tags.description: The new tags of the monitor resource.

TagAction.description: Valid actions for a filtering tag. Exclusion takes priority over inclusion.

FilteringTag.description: The definition of a filtering tag. Filtering tags are used for capturing resources and include/exclude them from being monitored.

name.description: The name (also known as the key) of the tag.

LogRules.description: Set of rules for sending logs for the Monitor resource.

sendAadLogs.description: Flag specifying if AAD logs should be sent for the Monitor resource.

sendSubscriptionLogs.description: Flag specifying if Azure subscription logs should be sent for the Monitor resource.

sendResourceLogs.description: Flag specifying if Azure resource logs should be sent for the Monitor resource.

filteringTags.description: List of filtering tags to be used for capturing logs. This only takes effect if SendResourceLogs flag is enabled. If empty, all resources will be captured. If only Exclude action is specified, the rules will apply to the list of all available resources. If Include actions are specified, the rules will only include resources with the associated tags.

MetricRules.description: Set of rules for sending metrics for the Monitor resource.

filteringTags.description: List of filtering tags to be used for capturing metrics. If empty, all resources will be captured. If only Exclude action is specified, the rules will apply to the list of all available resources. If Include actions are specified, the rules will only include resources with the associated tags.

MonitoringTagRulesProperties.description: Definition of the properties for a TagRules resource.

customMetrics.description: Configuration to enable/disable custom metrics. If enabled, custom metrics from app insights will be sent.

MonitoringTagRules.description: Capture logs and metrics of Azure resources based on ARM tags.

id.description: The id of the rule set.

type.description: The type of the rule set.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results, if any.

SingleSignOnStates.description: Various states of the SSO resource

enterpriseAppId.description: The Id of the Enterprise App used for Single sign-on.

singleSignOnUrl.description: The login URL specific to this Datadog Organization.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results, if any.

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: Common fields that are returned in the response for all Azure Resource Manager resources

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

AzureEntityResource.title: Entity Resource
AzureEntityResource.description: The resource model definition for an Azure Resource Manager resource with an etag.

TrackedResource.title: Tracked Resource
TrackedResource.description: The resource model definition for an Azure Resource Manager tracked top level resource which has 'tags' and a 'location'

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

ProxyResource.title: Proxy Resource
ProxyResource.description: The resource model definition for a Azure Resource Manager proxy resource. It will not have tags and a location

ResourceModelWithAllowedPropertySet.description: The resource model definition containing the full set of allowed properties for a resource. Except properties bag, there cannot be a top level property outside of this set.

managedBy.description: The fully qualified resource ID of the resource that manages this resource. Indicates if this resource is managed by another Azure resource. If this is present, complete mode deployment will not delete the resource if it is removed from the template since it is managed by another resource.

kind.description: Metadata used by portal/tooling/etc to render different UX experiences for resources of the same type. E.g. ApiApps are a kind of Microsoft.Web/sites type.  If supported, the resource provider must validate and persist this value.

etag.description: The etag field is *not* required. If it is provided in the response body, it must also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. HTTP/1.1 uses entity tags in the etag (section 14.19), If-Match (section 14.24), If-None-Match (section 14.26), and If-Range (section 14.27) header fields.

Sku.description: The resource model definition representing SKU

name.description: The name of the SKU. E.g. P3. It is typically a letter+number code

size.description: The SKU size. When the name field is the combination of tier and some other value, this would be the standalone code.

family.description: If the service has different generations of hardware, for the same SKU, then that can be captured here.

capacity.description: If the SKU supports scale out/in then the capacity integer should be included. If scale out/in is not possible for the resource this may be omitted.

principalId.description: The principal ID of resource identity. The value must be an UUID.

tenantId.description: The tenant ID of resource. The value must be an UUID.

name.description: A user defined name of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being procured.

publisher.description: The publisher of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being bought. E.g. NewRelic

product.description: The 3rd Party artifact that is being procured. E.g. NewRelic. Product maps to the OfferID specified for the artifact at the time of Data Market onboarding.

promotionCode.description: A publisher provided promotion code as provisioned in Data Market for the said product/artifact.

version.description: The version of the desired product/artifact.

ErrorResponse.title: Error response
ErrorResponse.description: Common error response for all Azure Resource Manager APIs to return error details for failed operations. (This also follows the OData error response format.).

ErrorAdditionalInfo.description: The resource management error additional info.

Operation.title: REST API Operation
Operation.description: Details of a REST API operation, returned from the Resource Provider Operations API

name.description: The name of the operation, as per Resource-Based Access Control (RBAC). Examples: "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/write", "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/capture/action"

isDataAction.description: Whether the operation applies to data-plane. This is "true" for data-plane operations and "false" for ARM/control-plane operations.

display.description: Localized display information for this particular operation.

provider.description: The localized friendly form of the resource provider name, e.g. "Microsoft Monitoring Insights" or "Microsoft Compute".

resource.description: The localized friendly name of the resource type related to this operation. E.g. "Virtual Machines" or "Job Schedule Collections".

operation.description: The concise, localized friendly name for the operation; suitable for dropdowns. E.g. "Create or Update Virtual Machine", "Restart Virtual Machine".

description.description: The short, localized friendly description of the operation; suitable for tool tips and detailed views.

origin.description: The intended executor of the operation; as in Resource Based Access Control (RBAC) and audit logs UX. Default value is "user,system"

actionType.description: Enum. Indicates the action type. "Internal" refers to actions that are for internal only APIs.

locationData.description: Metadata pertaining to the geographic location of the resource.

name.description: A canonical name for the geographic or physical location.

city.description: The city or locality where the resource is located.

district.description: The district, state, or province where the resource is located.

countryOrRegion.description: The country or region where the resource is located

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

encryptionProperties.description: Configuration of key for data encryption

status.description: Indicates whether or not the encryption is enabled for container registry.

keyIdentifier.description: Key vault uri to access the encryption key.

identity.description: The client ID of the identity which will be used to access key vault.

name.description: The name of the resource for which availability needs to be checked.

nameAvailable.description: Indicates if the resource name is available.

reason.description: The reason why the given name is not available.

message.description: Detailed reason why the given name is available.

OperationStatusResult.description: The current status of an async operation.

id.description: Fully qualified ID for the async operation.

resourceId.description: Fully qualified ID of the resource against which the original async operation was started.

percentComplete.description: Percent of the operation that is complete.

startTime.description: The start time of the operation.

endTime.description: The end time of the operation.

error.description: If present, details of the operation error.

SkuTier.description: This field is required to be implemented by the Resource Provider if the service has more than one tier, but is not required on a PUT.
